jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

FA3250AB0AC34192B8A63FCEA371A95C.description:
Can demonstrate skill in memorizing chunks of fingerreading
units (including lexicalized fingerspelling) when translating
to written English as content-appropriate (e.g., increasing
length of fingerspelled word #HAT to #PLAY/ER to #REST/AU/
RANT).

E820B7D924E647CF86EC927CC4E42DE9.description:
Fingerspell longer words and phrases following correct
contour as new ASL and English lexicon expands (e.g.,
fs G-O-V-E-R-N-M-E-N-T, fs R-A-I-N-I-N-G fs C-A-T-S and
#DOGS).

081103ED846E48258F588B4C91D3C6F5.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

D26A435482A04CC8A899D60F4F744B23.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

0CD806442FB3445C867C278023F6A07E.description:
Engage in creative use of fingerspelling (e.g., fs F-A-L-L-I-N-G
L-E-A-F).

6395585D836E4A779DCC358621F029DF.description:
Understand the role of fingerspelling in ASL and the multiple
uses of fingerspelling (e.g., codeswitching).

83AE7E2221C74126977EA2ECA65BD701.description:
Demonstrate understanding of ways fingerspelled signs are
formed and their uses.

867405E8899A4CE49DE05A1D87B46E0F.description:
Use signs and phrases acquired through conversations, signing
and being signed to, and responding to texts, including using
adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., IF HAPPEN OTHER
HAPPY, MEANS ME HAPPY).

6339A463CE684613A109624224A21C10.description:
Manipulate phonological parameters to play on signs (e.g.,
SMALL-WORLD with pinky, UNDERSTAND with four fingers
or pinky to show intensity).

8898D88FFDA1479991939B31EBE7894E.description:
With teacher guidance and support, use figurative language
versus literal language using metaphors, similes, and
analogies.

D2D1445DE24742319EBE0C4024F9D91D.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related
inflectional verbs (e.g., TOSS, THROW, HURL) and closely
related adjectives through use of depictions and nonmanual markers (e.g., CL: 1 YOUNG-PERSON, CL: BENT 1:
OLD PERSON).

924003DD6448421688749725814665A8.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., describe foods that are SPICY, MUSHY).

F785D785C1604A808F4ADB7C30220CB2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of sign relationships and nuances
in sign meanings.

5E9D6FD0C0ED42A9BC38B8C2D0C8F078.description:
Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and
digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and
phrases.

9B99EB1A9DA04B1ABC7573BD76ECAE4D.description:
Use knowledge of the meaning of individual signs to predict
the meaning of compound signs (e.g., UP-TO-YOU is a blend
of THINK+YOURSELF).

A4FFD1198896490AB7537C5941E25C70.description:
Identify new meanings for similar signs and apply them
accurately (e.g., TURN-OFF TV, SWITCH-OFF-LIGHTS).

505B22DADD034E13AED787505CC7C0DE.description:
Use sentence-level context to identify the meaning of
unknown signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases.

45EE66A93FDF479A95783A4B22F3035D.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases based grade
2 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from an array of
strategies.

D69A8964B1A74C68B7DD454DA723EB5D.description:
Compare formal and informal uses of American Sign
Language.

750E60832E8A4FBBBA9DEDF4B04F68A8.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

F1B66501EC854BD193EF8201B4E67FB8.description:
Create complex sentences to indicate a sequence of events
and use step-by-step instructions using correct sequence
markers (e.g., transition words).

89952AB4CB724689B652350064175479.description:
Evaluate sentences for semantic appropriateness (e.g., DAD
DANCE WITH HAMBURGER).

F1E5C94D16CF4DF89F2C47FC92013389.description: Produce simple and complex conditional sentences.

428E4C455A4D40A49311ED963F7CC439.description:
Produce simple and complex sentences with indicating
verbs using plural pronouns as referents. (e.g., I-GIVE-THEM,
THEY-TOLD-US).

D71016EDD4A7470E899B5FA2EDBE8D25.description:
Manipulate spatial referents when incorporating frequently
occurring prepositions through classifiers, eye gaze, and
locative signs (e.g., role shifting, CL: 5 BIG-HOUSE-nearby,
CL:5 BIG-HOUSE-far away).

808D4F005CD841EFA8AD82D8241566D4.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., WHY-Q, WRONG,
FINISH, HAPPEN).

708D98115CA04082A7D7E98179559491.description: Maintain hands in signing frame space.

FAEF33FBAB0643AAAD55C7800B6D5977.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

AF729588AA2F4EF7A98A757A1052CEEF.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.
(See grade 2 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations)

FDEA29D54EED412697F4CE64C96E189B.description:
Create stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays
to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to
clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

1549E2E6D9124CFCB5FD171F6064AE36.description:
Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts
and relevant, descriptive details, signing clearly in coherent
sentences.

6B0F853E610D4CEFAE7C19E433DAFF52.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a signer says in order
to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or
deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

1ED5E68339F848CCB4631AD8E92632A0.description:
Recount or describe key ideas or details from a storytelling or
storysigning or information signed or through other media.

05D4C3422E6D49FCB2A80C2AE569ECD6.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed
about the topics and texts under discussion.

77B6B7D2762E47D893FA64185A0E4FCE.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by linking their
comments to the remarks of others.

3B69CE4BEE104D7C89DB79CFCC436F1B.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining
the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care,
signing one at a time about the topics and texts under
discussion).

98B799FF05264132816EF19CAD01D340.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small
and larger groups.

69DB47B781D54AA19A0D03AC2393A780.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (e.g.,
a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

2B39587F9F754B4A96249F7871A8C23B.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information
from provided sources to answer a question.

A179351AC1DD4ACB9912D1AEFE79F13F.description:
Participate in shared research and signing projects (e.g., view
a number of texts on a single topic to produce a report; record
science observations).

988A7AC615EC463CA9CAB22C5270C89B.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A39719FC5E704639B5235198A1ED1A36.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of
digital tools to produce and publish signing, including in
collaboration with peers.

9E41CED676524FE0A253D7F5C89AE08B.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on
a topic and strengthen signing as needed by revising and
editing.

3D63689EA866487FBFB1E90AE39188FD.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce signing in
which the development and organization are appropriate to
task and purpose. (Grade-specific expectations for signing
types are defined in standards 1-3 above.)

62F74366A02544488263E6C61877C85E.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

EE0E24A310D4417687820C23558039FF.description:
Sign narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event
or short sequence of events, including details to describe
actions, thoughts and feelings, use temporal signs, inflections,
and phrases to signal event order, and provide a sense of
closure.

44C1DC6857E845FF894A91AF0945A5F8.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a
topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide
a concluding statement or section.

83379E342D0D48C3B2426009F99C7958.description:
Sign opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or
name the text they are signing about, state an opinion, supply
reasons for the opinion, use linking signs (e.g., transitional
signs: PLUS, WHY-Q) to connect opinion and reasons, and
provide a concluding statement or section.

789A4805BEB94903B0313D1A2C5BFBA7.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct sign recognition and
understanding, re-viewing as necessary.

1C162EF2F5F24BE096BBAEE3BA9A9B19.description:
View on-level text with accuracy, appropriate rate, and
expression on successive viewings for both published and
live texts.

731F41B191854F96BBB293FE45941420.description: View on-level text with purpose and understanding.

619C67AEA80B406F8E416313B99B42AC.description:
View and sign on-level texts with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

C63199489C5B41D39D0DF98D23CA391A.description:
Recognize spatial positioning of signs inform their meanings
(e.g., HOT-group vs. COLD-group and their referents).

981AF26BE4C643928412FFAB0CFEE96D.description:
Recognize the derivatives of blended signs inform the
meaning of blended signs (e.g., KNOW+THAT = KNOWTHAT).

F6DE592C2971432A9AA9DE5C212F7124.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

CB533CED1CFF4C19B5602E69CCD03EA4.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with
scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

60EC5848880943F5BFA07EBB9CBA694D.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

C35858D486454C6A86A9F76C6C07D4EF.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points presented
by two texts on the same topic.

154BA027D63841FFB3173BA19E32A65E.description:
Describe how reasons support specific points the author
makes in a text.

76FBD91FA6DB45BD9269E7D5FA1791B0.description:
Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a
machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

81DA525B1E814035B59471DA4678A624.description:
Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author
wants to answer, explain, or describe.

F5F7CE8A1C914337BF29969F409BD63D.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., visual transition
effects) and text structures (e.g., sequence and transition
phrases) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

DE4AC5CC0E41453BAD52D898F69222B5.description:
Determine the meaning of fingerspelled words, signs, and
phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

028A64891588408B9E2C6F3AB0C2419C.description:
Describe the connection between a series of historical events,
scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures
in a text.

E499F32EB0444DF6A639D5E93D0C416F.description:
Identify the main topic of a multi-paragraph text as well as the
focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

237E05CFE36544CCBC00A0F5F13E2151.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when,
why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in
a text.

F579DC7A318840F29667F41D24159888.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories and poetry, in the grades 2-3 text complexity
band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end
of the range.

2370CC1EE9BA479484303FBB6388BD2B.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

BE2B0441BF8C4C0DB968DC903D1E8E0F.description:
Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same
story (e.g., Eyeth) by different authors and/or signers or from
different cultures.

D50EADFDCD93409FA6D717A34DAADC47.description:
Use information gained from the illustrations and signs in text
to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or
plot.

97C51584567043B58945FBAEF15A7AA3.description:
Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters,
including by signing in a different style for each character
when signing dialogue (e.g., role shifting, eye gaze).

28BCAA61CC094F2596B1D2E818DBFF13.description:
Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing
how the beginning introduces the story and the ending
concludes the action.

64E7C9F60ACC42E7A47A3800FA75E61A.description:
Describe how fingerspelling words, signs, and phrases (e.g.,
patterned handshapes and/or signs, rhymes, repeated lines)
supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

D802264C37A747F99E838280F0C95CEA.description:
Describe how characters in a story respond to major events
and challenges.

0C90BAF717EA4116A8A7089381410CFC.description:
Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse
cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

0C906ECAD9C447E5B19E215017B57E98.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when,
why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in
a text.
